bboxes.raw_text:
Atty. Willard B. Rams ON, gen
eral manager of the Nine. C. ].
Walker Manufacturing Company
with headquarters in lndianap-
oils, Indiana, received the first
Alumni Distinguished Service
Award from Talladega College.


A 1896 summa cum laude grad
uate of Talladega and a 1889
graduate of Harvard University
Law School, was cited for his
"adventurous contributions to
human dignity and freedom in
community and state. and to edu-
cation through alma mater and
loyal alumni service"


His long and consistent record
of fighting for Civil Rights has
been recognized by earlier cita-
tions. In 1949 Attorney Ransom
received the Cable Award for
outstanding work in Race Rela-
lions and Community Service in
Indianapolis, and he has twice
been selected by the INDfANAP-
OILS RECORDER on the Honor
Roll for outstanding service in
Race Relations.


AS state president of the In
diana State Conference of NAACP
branches he spent five years in
its reorganization and strength
ening. Rams ON drafted the Indiana
anti-segregated school law and
the state Conference of NAACP
Branches received a national
award for its work in getting that
law passed under his leadership
as State President.


Appointed in 1868 by Governor
Matthew E. Welsh as chairman of
the American Negro Emancipa-
tion Centennial Authority of In
diana, Attorney Ransom helped
promote an exposition of Negro
life and history. the production
of a book on Indiana Negroes
from 1868 to 1868, and college
scholarships. The important out
growth was the incorporation of
material on Negro history and
contributions to American life
into the state curriculum.


In the business world, Ransom
has promoted the expansion Of
the Walker Manufacturing Com
pany of Beauty Culture.

NEW YORK - Msgr. John j.
Henegahn, Chancellor of the
Brooklyn diocese, urges Roman
Catholic church members in
Brooklyn and Queens boroughs
to traven in groups during the
daylight hours because of the
recent outbreak of attacks by
young Negro gangs.

9Musical Carnation", a pro-
gram Of songs was presented
Sum-. June at the Mr.. Olive
Baptist Church in Chandler.
Pearl Ferguson directed the
Arizona State Chorus.


Eight soloists Wed for the

OXFORD Pa. - NAACP Gen.
eral Counsel Robert L. Carter
is scheduled to receive Doc
torate of Laws degree from Lin
coin University at exercises on
June Z.


Mr.. Carter received his Bach
elors degree from Lincoln Uni
versity. He also holds degrees
from Howard University in Wash
ington and Columbia Univer sity in
New York City.

queens crown. Final GROWING
will be held in the fall.


Mrs. Clara Long, of Phoenix,
is the temporary chairman. Her
escort was T. Burnett, Of
Chandler.
Musical Progrum Given At Chandler Church

hat show displaying the funniest chapeaus was
featured at the H. Lodge 1907 South 9TH Ave.
Sum-, June z.


SPONSORED bv the Grand Birthday dep
the program craftsmanship Of Mines Gertrude
Clements Alberta Perkins.


others assisting Mmes Mary Boozer and Florence Ses-



Modelling their from left Mesdames Elvia Lewis
Ruby Blackshear Brown Lillian Cagle Lillian Fit and Alice
Wheeler.


Tommy Davis Blue Flames provided the musical
setting at the hat show.
